intro: Epilobium pseudorubescens, commonly known as the redstem willow herb, is a flowering plant belonging to the Onagraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, often reddish stems and lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers with four petals, usually in shades of pink or white, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in open habitats such as meadows and stream banks. Epilobium pseudorubescens is a perennial species that plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
